column3: Everything looks to be in order... Hm? Is aught amiss?
...If this is about that damned protest, I don't want to hear it.
Fury take me, so many guests with so many questions! Oh! Um...you don't happen to have any questions, do you?
Everything looks to be in order...I think. <sigh> Is aught amiss?
What kind of place is this?
Keep watch for dragons and heretics, what else? You never know when the enemy might strike.
It is my duty to ensure that the reconstruction of Falcon's Nest proceeds apace. To that end, our craftsmen must be able to work without fear for their safety.
House Durendaire shares this responsibility with House Dzemael. Should our efforts come to naught, both houses will have to answer to the Holy See.
Keep watch for dragons and heretics, what else? You never know when the enemy might strike.
Of course, when they <Emphasis>do</Emphasis> strike, there's no guarantee we'll be able to do a damn thing about it...
Just thinking back to that ceremony makes me shudder. It's a bloody miracle that wyrm didn't slaughter us all then and there.
Falcon's Nest was once a hamlet with a small garrison of knights. Many were skilled falconers who trained their birds to track the Horde.
When the snows came, the garrison was forced to withdraw, along with most everyone else in the western highlands.
But times have changed. The Holy See would have us reclaim what was lost, starting with Falcon's Nest. It won't be easy, but anything worth doing rarely is, eh?
